definition: to capture/to restrain/to constrain/to adhere rigidly to/inflexible
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve

sentences.english: The suspect is currently under criminal detention.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪嫌疑人目前正被刑事拘留。

sentences.english: The criminal detention has become coe…
sentences.chinese: 应进一步修改以完善刑事拘留条件。

sentences.english: We are placing your son in criminal detention.
sentences.chinese: 我们对你儿子实行刑事拘留。

sentences.english: He was held in criminal custody due to theft.
sentences.chinese: 他因为盗窃被刑事拘留。

sentences.english: At present, the suspect X-hua Wu has been under criminal detention.
sentences.chinese: 目前，犯罪嫌疑人吴X华已被刑事拘留。

sentences.english: The proportion principle is adopted in the whole process of the legislation and adjudication of the criminal detention.
sentences.chinese: 比例原则完全贯穿于刑事拘留的立法和司法当中。

definition: to detain as criminal/criminal detention/abbr. for 刑事拘留[xing2 shi4 ju1 liu2]
release from custody, subject to provision of a surety, pending investigation (PRC)
to make a full confession/to plead guilty
to file for investigation/to prosecute (a case)
to detain (a prisoner)/to keep sb in custody
to bring to justice/to file away (a document)
